item.title: Failing Often
item.description: It's Sunday morning and I'm reflecting on my failures.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: It's Sunday morning and I'm reflecting on my failures.

item.title: The Dojo in Your Mind
item.description: I just read Brian Gilham's piece, You Don't Need a Computer Science Degree, which simply makes the point that prospective iOS developers (or let's face it, any developer) don't need a computer science degree to become successful in this field.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: I just read Brian Gilham's piece, You Don't Need a Computer Science Degree, which simply makes the point that prospective iOS developers (or let's face it, any developer) don't need a computer science degree to become successful in this field.

item.title: Microelectronics are my new jam.
item.description: I've spent most of the past decade with a near-maniacal, laser-guided focus on one ambition: to become an indie software developer. It officially kicked off after seeing Daniel Jalkut give a talk at C4 in 2007. Success hasn't turned out to be exactly what I thought, though it would be
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: I've spent most of the past decade with a near-maniacal, laser-guided focus on one ambition: to become an indie software developer.

item.title: New Blog, New Something Something
item.description: I've been writing on this blog since 2008, and in that time it's been all Wordpress. In these last eight years I've seen Wordpress rise, become enormously popular, turn into a CMS and a replacement for web development altogether. I've also seen it turn into a popular vector for hackers.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: I've been writing on this blog since 2008, and in that time it's been all Wordpress.

item.title: Why Contracting is the Answer
item.description: I got my first job out of school back in 1998. I was responsible for building and maintaining a website for a Hamilton-based magazine publisher. Less than three months into it, the publisher fired me: we appeared to have fundamental differences of opinion on what my job actually was. I
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: I got my first job out of school back in 1998.

item.title: AppleTV and the iCloudpocalypse
item.description: First, the good news: Magpie for AppleTV is coming.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: First, the good news: Magpie for AppleTV is coming. Here’s proof!

item.title: Disingenuous
item.description: This is a post about Marco Arment’s decision to implement patronage pricing for his app, Overcast.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: This is a post about Marco Arment’s decision to implement patronage pricing for his app, Overcast.

item.title: I'm Looking for a Partner
item.description: Here’s the short version: I’m looking for someone to team up with, hopefully for the long term.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: Here’s the short version: I’m looking for someone to team up with, hopefully for the long term. Someone who can take what I build, and make sure the right people know about it.

item.title: Apple's Indifference to Developers
item.description: Developer Greg Gardner, whose app was rejected in September for violated unpublished guidelines, wrote a detailed account of the process.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Vegh
item.content:encoded: Developer Greg Gardner, whose app was rejected in September for violated unpublished guidelines, wrote a detailed account of the process.
